\"amount\" of available xArx from \"userAddress\" to caller (ie usage contract) Caller must have an allocation approval for the required xArx xArx from \"userAddress\""},"allowance(address,address)":{"details":"See {IERC20-allowance}."},"approve(address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-approve}. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address."},"approveUsage(address,uint256)":{"details":"Approves \"usage\" address to get allocations up to \"amount\" of xArx from msg.sender IXArxTokIXTokenUsageenUsage is the systems plugin interface."},"balanceOf(address)":{"details":"See {IERC20-balanceOf}."},"cancelRedeem(uint256)":{"details":"Cancels an ongoing redeem entry Can only be called by its owner"},"convert(uint256)":{"details":"Convert caller's \"amount\" of ARX to xArx"},"convertTo(uint256,address)":{"details":"Convert caller's \"amount\" of ARX to xArx to \"to\" address"},"deallocate(address,uint256,bytes)":{"details":"Deallocates caller's \"amount\" of available xArx from \"usageAddress\" contract args specific to usage contract must be passed into \"usageData\""},"deallocateFromUsage(address,uint256)":{"details":"Deallocates \"amount\" of allocated xArx belonging to \"userAddress\" from caller (ie usage contract) Caller can only deallocate xArx from itself"},"decimals()":{"details":"Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5,05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the value {ERC20} uses, unless {_setupDecimals} is called. NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}."},"decreaseAllowance(address,uint256)":{"details":"Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`."},"finalizeRedeem(uint256)":{"details":"Finalizes redeem process when vesting duration has been reached Can only be called by the redeem entry owner"},"getUsageAllocation(address,address)":{"details":"returns allocated xARX from \"userAddress\" to \"usageAddress\""},"getUsageApproval(address,address)":{"details":"returns approved xARX to allocate from \"userAddress\" to \"usageAddress\""},"getUserRedeem(address,uint256)":{"details":"returns \"userAddress\" info for a pending redeem identified by \"redeemIndex\""},"getUserRedeemsLength(address)":{"details":"returns quantity of \"userAddress\" pending redeems"},"increaseAllowance(address,uint256)":{"details":"Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address."},"isTransferWhitelisted(address)":{"details":"returns if \"account\" is allowed to send/receive xARX"},"name()":{"details":"Returns the name of the token."},"owner()":{"details":"Returns the address of the current owner."},"redeem(uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Initiates redeem process (xArx to ARX) Handles dividends' compensation allocation during the vesting process if needed"},"renounceOwnership()":{"details":"Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner."},"symbol()":{"details":"Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name."},"totalSupply()":{"details":"See {IERC20-totalSupply}."},"transfer(address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`."},"transferFrom(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20}. Requirements: - `sender` and `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - `sender` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for ``sender``'s tokens of at least `amount`."},"transferOwnership(address)":{"details":"Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). length of transferWhitelist array"},"updateDeallocationFee(address,uint256)":{"details":"Updates fee paid by users when deallocating from address for an existing active redeeming process Can only be called by the involved user Should only be used if dividends contract was to be migrated"},"updateRedeemSettings(uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"Updates all redeem ratios and durations Must only be called by s/@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/ReentrancyGuard.sol":{"keccak256":"0x8bbbc2f5c10065ee272592ae0a7a6ceb23de2fbd81564ee0bb015ecf404d5f61","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://b95e56c1640d0ef789fc5c16269e141e992f6c8ac97cc6d377bd3825e9cab182","dweb:/ipfs/QmVzaxJZY51EhagrcNnkxoU6Uq17RhATe7aHvtkC6wUkgK"]}},"version":1}

allocate(address,uint256,bytes).details: Allocates caller's "amount" of available xArx to "usageAddress" contract args specific to usage contract must be passed into "usageData"

allocateFromUsage(address,uint256).details: Allocates "amount" of available xArx from "userAddress" to caller (ie usage contract) Caller must have an allocation approval for the required xArx xArx from "userAddress"

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

approveUsage(address,uint256).details: Approves "usage" address to get allocations up to "amount" of xArx from msg.sender IXArxTokIXTokenUsageenUsage is the systems plugin interface.

cancelRedeem(uint256).details: Cancels an ongoing redeem entry Can only be called by its owner

convert(uint256).details: Convert caller's "amount" of ARX to xArx

convertTo(uint256,address).details: Convert caller's "amount" of ARX to xArx to "to" address

deallocate(address,uint256,bytes).details: Deallocates caller's "amount" of available xArx from "usageAddress" contract args specific to usage contract must be passed into "usageData"

deallocateFromUsage(address,uint256).details: Deallocates "amount" of allocated xArx belonging to "userAddress" from caller (ie usage contract) Caller can only deallocate xArx from itself

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5,05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the value {ERC20} uses, unless {_setupDecimals} is called. NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

finalizeRedeem(uint256).details: Finalizes redeem process when vesting duration has been reached Can only be called by the redeem entry owner

getUsageApproval(address,address).details: returns approved xARX to allocate from "userAddress" to "usageAddress"

getUserRedeem(address,uint256).details: returns "userAddress" info for a pending redeem identified by "redeemIndex"

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

isTransferWhitelisted(address).details: returns if "account" is allowed to send/receive xARX

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

redeem(uint256,uint256).details: Initiates redeem process (xArx to ARX) Handles dividends' compensation allocation during the vesting process if needed

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20}. Requirements: - `sender` and `recipient` cannot be the zero address. - `sender` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for ``sender``'s tokens of at least `amount`.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

transferWhitelist(uint256).details: returns transferWhitelist array item's address for "index"

updateDeallocationFee(address,uint256).details: Updates fee paid by users when deallocating from "usageAddress"

updateDividendsAddress(address).details: Updates dividends contract address Must only be called by owner

updateRedeemDividendsAddress(uint256).details: Updates dividends address for an existing active redeeming process Can only be called by the involved user Should only be used if dividends contract was to be migrated

updateRedeemSettings(uint256,uint256,uin.details: Updates all redeem ratios and durations Must only be called by owner

updateTransferWhitelist(address,bool).details: Adds or removes addresses from the transferWhitelist
